title: 48 companies you didn't know were using Rails in 2026
partialText: Rails is still alive and kicking in 2026, and a lot of companies trust it for their applications and backend infrastructure.

title: Claude Code skills: Automating FDA-required documentation for software as a medical device
partialText: Generating and maintaining FDA-required documentation for software as a medical device can be tedious and time-consuming. We built a Claude Code skill to automate documentation for 510(k) submissions.

title: The Bike Shed Ep 495:  A shortcut to years of experience
partialText: Sally and Aji flick through thoughtbot’s guide to best practices in a bid to brush up on their coding habits.

title: Going beyond vibe coding with ReadySetGo
partialText: Introducing ReadySetGo. An AI application generator that creates first versions of products, built in Rails, to thoughtbot’s best practices. Not throwaway, vibe-coded prototypes. Real foundations that can be built upon.

title: Giant Robots Podcast Ep 603:  The product we are going to build
partialText: Sami makes his triumphant return to the Giant Robots Smashing into other Giant Robots Podcast as he and his fellow hosts discuss a brand new tool currently in pre-production at thoughtbot.

title: Our first Tech Leaders Meetup in Bristol, UK
partialText: Our Tech Leader UK Tour is coming to Bristol on March 19th. This is your invite to connect in person with the thoughtbot team and other product leaders in South West England.

title: A JavaScript developer's guide to Rails: Authorization with Pundit
partialText: Learn how Pundit authorization actually works in Rails, from request flow to policy scopes, with practical examples for JavaScript developers.

title: The Bike Shed Ep 494:  Primitive Obsession
partialText: Joël and Sally examine the simpler components of programming and why using basic data structures may not always be the best approach to solving a problem.
